  • Knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs), efficient ML (quantization, distillation etc.) and transfer learning and fine-tuning.
  • Experience with Azure Services including Azure Datalake/Datahouse and Azure Databricks.
  • Experience with Rest API.
  • Familiarity with containerized (Docker) applications and Kubernetes.



What We Offer:

  • A stimulating and innovative work environment.
  • Flexible working options: 50/50 work from our Utrecht office or home.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  • A collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing is encouraged.


Apply Now:

If you are ready to play a crucial role at FRISS, we want to hear from you! Apply now via recruitment@friss.com to become our ML Engineer at FRISS and make a meaningful impact on our success.



About FRISS:

FRISS is a leading provider in fraud detection and risk mitigation solutions for the insurance industry. Founded in 2006, FRISS holds its head office in Utrecht, The Netherlands, with a global presence and global workforce, including Europe, the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth we are now recruiting for Data Scientist to be based at our customer site in Gothenburg.




Our Digital Enterprise Solutions (DES) Department leverages extensive manufacturing know-how for enlightened enterprise systems. Our deep industry experience allows us to drastically reduce process time and effectively streamline business flows for any organization. Our world-class consultants enable organizations to realize the power of the integrated enterprise by providing superior consulting and implementation services.




Do you love to play with data and want to make a real impact on our electrification journey?

Then you should join our small, but growing, team of Data Scientists at Traction Battery. We offer you a varied work with room to follow exciting threads in the data until the end. We will challenge you and expect you to do the same to bring out the best from each and one of us.




Responsibilities:




You will perform data analyses based on measurement data from test / field /customer vehicles to follow up on battery usage including battery degradation and quality related issues.

The insights will be used to support development of battery systems including design both HW and SW components. An important part of the work is to develop mathematical models for prediction of battery behavior with special focus on battery ageing. You will also define requirements for data collection together with component owners and system architects. Your results will be used by many internal stakeholders within the company including R&D, but also teams working with quality, service, and aftermarket. You will also contribute to an increased usage of data driven development within the company in general and facilitate interactions with the rest of the data community in the company.




Knowledge/skills:




We see that you have a master’s degree in engineering, preferably within Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or similar with a couple of years of relevant experience.

You will need skills in Python and scientific packages like NumPy, Pandas etc. and experience in building data pipelines, data transformation and data visualization.

You share our passion for vehicle electrification and enjoy being part of a team.

Your analytic ability, creativity and interaction with different teams create a great atmosphere for innovative solutions.

You have a conceptual thinking, not afraid of taking vital actions when required.




If you in addition have skills in any of below it is beneficial:

• Version control tools for collaborative development (Git)

• Familiarity with working on modern cloud-based environments

• AI/Machine learning and Databases (SQL) • DevOps tools such as Kubernetes and Docker

• Experience with CI/CD tools such as Tekton and ArgoCD

• BI tools like Power BI or similar.







If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on and want to join a global company, then this is the place for you.




Tata Technologies: Engineering a better world.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist

Location: Lisbon - Hybrid

Salary: €60,000 - €65,000




We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python, data types, and basic algorithms, with expertise in memory management, data manipulation using Pandas and Numpy, and scientific computing with Scipy. Additionally, a solid understanding of probability theory, time series analysis, classical machine learning algorithms, and deep learning is essential.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Manipulation and Analysis:

Utilize Pandas, Numpy, and Scipy for efficient data manipulation and analysis.
Implement and optimize basic algorithms with a focus on memory management.




Probability and Statistics:

Apply probability theory concepts including probability density, cumulative distribution function, normal distribution, and quantiles.
Conduct time series analysis, focusing on autocorrelations, stationarity, and statistical criteria for time series.




Machine Learning:

Develop and implement forecasting algorithms and evaluate their performance using relevant metrics.
Apply classical machine learning algorithms including decision trees, gradient boosting, and xgboost.
Design, train, evaluate, and deploy deep learning models using Pytorch.




System Design and Deployment:

Ensure effective model monitoring and horizontal scaling.
Address system design topics to optimize model deployment and performance.




Requirements:




Technical Skills:

Proficient in Python, with a deep understanding of data types, basic algorithms, and memory management.
Experience with data manipulation and analysis using Pandas, Numpy, and Scipy.
Strong knowledge of probability theory and its applications in data science.
Expertise in time series analysis and forecasting.
Proficient in classical machine learning algorithms and boosting techniques.
Experienced in deep learning with a focus on neural networks and Pytorch.




Additional Skills:

Ability to train, evaluate, and deploy machine learning models.
Strong understanding of model monitoring and horizontal scaling.
Familiarity with system design concepts related to data science and machine learning.




If you are interested in finding out more, please APPLY & get in touch with Libby Dewar @ Allegiance Technology

Title: Data Scientist, Renewable Energy Forecasting
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Data Scientist? Do you want to develop algorithms for forecasting and trading renewable electricity? And are you interested in working at a Scale-Up that contributes intelligent solutions to the energy infrastructure of the future? Then green.ai might have the job for you.




We are looking for a Data Scientist for our Asset team to develop fully automated algorithms to help wind turbines, solar panels and other electricity producers to get the most out of their assets. 




Responsibilities:




Develop and deploy different ml algorithms, enhancing our capabilities to forecast and trade
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate algorithms into our platform




Qualifications - we imagine that you:




Have a strong theoretical background and understanding of statistics/probability theory/optimization 
Are knowledgeable about implementing machine learning algorithms (e.g. time-series models In python)
Are comfortable integrating models into a cloud-based infrastructure in collaboration with the team
Thrive in an environment that provides autonomy - with possibility of working either from your home office or from our office in the heart of Copenhagen
Have great communication skills - both with business stakeholders and with technical colleagues 




About us:




green.ai is an AI and technology company that develops algorithms for the global power system. This includes both distribution of power as well as trading. We are a scale-up with the heart of a start-up, creating time, space, and opportunities for employees to think innovatively and to test new algorithms. The team currently consists of 8 employees (and growing!), all energy data experts working to create the best solutions for the green power system of tomorrow.




We offer:




Work on some very cool algorithms that truly help our partners
Nice office close to the Metro (Gammel Strand) located in the Copenhagen center
Full-time position and salary according to qualifications along with pension
A flexible work schedule with opportunities to work remote when needed
An informal workplace where we care about each other
Annual company events and lots of social events
Lunch, coffee and snacks




Contact information:




If you are interested in the position or would like to learn more, please send your CV with contact information to: contact@green.ai or reach out to:

Peter Alexander Stentoft at mobile +45 5074 9651 or Kasper Hakon Sørensen at mobile +45 3016 0690

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (LLMs)
Description:
At Sinch, we pioneer the way the world communicates. Our customer communications cloud empowers businesses to reach everyone in world, in seconds or less, through mobile messaging, email, voice and video. We reach every phone on the planet 7 times a year and 8 out of 10 largest US tech companies are our customers. Sinch AI adds a layer of intentional intelligence on top of that, to build smarter, safer conversational experiences, faster.

As a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer, you will play a vital role in building and expanding the core machine learning capabilities of Conversational AI at Sinch. Working as part of a dynamic and cross-functional team, you will have the autonomy to define objectives and goals, taking ownership of the entire product development life cycle - from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance.

You will work on the intersection of the Generative AI team and the Conversational AI team of Sinch. The Conversational AI team is responsible for all conversational experiences in Sinch Chatlayer, Sinch Engage, and Sinch MessageMedia. Here, your focus will be on leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and generative AI to both make bot building much easier and bots themselves much more effective, natural and enjoyable. You will evaluate, test, customize, deploy, and integrate the latest LLMs into the platform to create more advanced and intuitive conversational experiences.

Our tech stack: Python, Kubernetes, GCP, AWS, PyTorch, MLFlow, OpenSearch, LangChain, OpenAI LLMs, Gemini LLMs, Open-Source LLMs like LLama

As a Machine Learning Engineer, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Experimenting with, applying, and benchmarking new algorithms, with a strong emphasis on LLMs and generative AI
Deploying machine learning code in the cloud
Proactively exploring new and emerging (generative) AI solutions that can enhance the value delivered to our product and customers
Contributing your innovative ideas to enable the development of human-like chat and voice bots using the latest advancements in generative AI
Setting up proof-of-concepts and transforming them into production-ready features


Requirements


You are an AI enthusiast who keeps up with the latest trends in AI and ML, and loves to use these new technologies to solve real-world problems
You have worked with machine learning for at least three years and are familiar with common natural language processing and machine learning concepts such as clustering, embeddings, neural networks,...
You have put machine learning applications in production before and are familiar with concepts such as unit testing, CI/CD pipelines and monitoring, but also on how you measure the quality of the machine learning solution
You have built an LLM-based application and are keen to build many more!
You are proficient in Python
You are fluent in English


Benefits

Sinch is a global company composed of people from different countries and cultures. Our benefits adjust regionally to support employees and help them to thrive in every stage of life. We offer valuable benefits and resources, including health and life insurance, a flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.

Our Hiring Process

In Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and equal opportunity. Our Talent Acquisition team, together with hiring managers and the rest of the interviewing team, persistently works towards identifying the people that best fit each open job, based on Sinch' s hiring needs and candidates' career expectations.

We encourage applications from strong candidates with relevant professional backgrounds for this role. Not all applicants will meet all job requirements exactly! Don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always open to candidates that could bring new insights and perspectives to Sinch!

Title: Data Scientist / ML-Engineer
Description:
ALGOTEQUE is an IT consultancy firm that helps startups, mid-sized and large corporations to create and deliver innovative technologies.

Our team has a successful track record in designing, developing, implementing, and integrating software solutions (AI, ML, BI, Web, Automation) for Telecom, Energy, Bank, Insurance, Pharma, Automotive, Industry, e-commerce. We deliver our services both in fixed-price and time-and-materials models, helping our customers achieve their business and IT strategies.

Job Description

Algoteque is seeking a talented Data Scientist / ML-Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role involves working on innovative projects for our clients, focusing on deep learning, model optimization, and production deployment.

Responsibilities

Deep Learning: Utilize deep learning techniques for tasks such as image, text, and video classification using neural networks.

Model Development: Collaborate with the team to develop, train, and research new and existing machine learning models.

ML-Ops: Implement and maintain ML-Ops practices to ensure models are effectively brought into production.

Data Science Ecosystem: Utilize the Python data science ecosystem, including tools like pandas and numpy, to analyze and manipulate data.

Feedback Loops: Develop and implement feedback loops to generate new training data as part of the machine learning lifecycle.

Best Practices: Apply best practices in machine learning and data science to ensure robust and reliable models.

Profile / Requirements

Deep Learning: Experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow.

Python: Proficiency in Python and familiarity with its data science ecosystem, including pandas and numpy.

Statistics: Solid foundations in statistics to support data analysis and model validation.

ML-Ops: Experience in ML-Ops, including bringing models into production and maintaining them.

Production Models: Proven experience in implementing and optimizing machine learning models for production environments.

Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently on complex tasks.

Preferred Qualities

Innovative Thinker: Ability to think creatively and propose innovative solutions to complex problems.

Team Collaboration: Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with other team members and stakeholders.

Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying updated with the latest developments in machine learning and data science.

What We Offer

Innovative Projects: Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects for leading clients.

Professional Growth: Continuous learning and development opportunities.

Flexible Work Environment: Remote work.

If you are a dedicated Data Scientist / ML-Engineer with a passion for deep learning and model optimization, we would love to hear from you.

Title: AI / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job details:

Full-time
Start date: August 2024
First contract till May 2025
Extensions possible







Scope:

Maintain and extend our Recommendation back-end.
Design, develop, run and evaluate online AB-tests to improve the quality of recommenders.
Support operational excellence through practices like code review and pair programming.
The entire team is responsible for the operations of our services. This includes actively monitoring different applications and their infrastructure as well as intervening to solve operational problems whenever they arise.
Keep up with developments in the wide field of Recommendations and Machine Learning.




Skills:




4+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
Affinity with data analysis
Pre-existing knowledge or experience with machine learning modelling
Interest in NLP
A natural interest in digital media products
English required

Technologies

AWS, Kafka, Python (FastAPI), SQL, Docker, Spark
Nice to have: vector databases, collaborative filtering/recommendation systems

Skills:


  • 4+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
  • Affinity with data analysis
  • Pre-existing knowledge or experience with machine learning modelling
  • Interest in NLP
  • A natural interest in digital media products
  • English required

Technologies

  • AWS, Kafka, Python (FastAPI), SQL, Docker, Spark
  • Nice to have: vector databases, collaborative filtering/recommendation systems

Title: Data Scientist Junior (F/H)
Description:
Description Du Poste

Tu es à la recherche de challenge et tu souhaites rejoindre une aventure dictée par un véritable esprit start-up ? Rejoins-nous !

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist Junior en CDI pour renforcer notre équipe R&D sur Paris.

A Ce Titre, Tes Missions Sont Les Suivantes


Collecter et analyser les données pour générer des insights stratégiques,
Développer des modèles prédictifs pour améliorer notre plateforme SAAS,
Participer activement à la mise en place de projets de Data Science,
Assurer la qualité des données et veiller à leur intégrité,
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes sales pour comprendre leurs besoins.


Profil recherché


Titulaire d'un diplôme BAC+5 en Data Science ou informatique,
Au moins 1 an d'expérience professionnelle en Data Science idéalement dans une start-up,
Excellente maîtrise de Python et des techniques de Data Science,
Connaissance d'autres outils de programmation tels que SQL serait un plus, -Maitrise de l’anglais courant
Reconnu(e) pour ton sens de l’analyse, tu fais preuve de rigueur et de méthodologie.

Title: Data Scientist - Intern
HTML:
ABOUT DESCARTES UNDERWRITING

Descartes was born out of the conviction that the ever-increasing complexity of risks faced by corporations, governments and vulnerable communities calls for a renewed approach in insurance.

Our team brings together industry veterans from the most renowned institutions (AXA, SCOR, Swiss Re, Marsh, Aon, ...) and scientists on top of their field to bring underwriting excellence. After 5 years of existence, Descartes has secured a leading position in parametric insurance for weather and climate-related risks utilizing machine learning, real-time monitoring from satellite imagery & IoT. After a successful Series B raise of $120M USD, we launched Descartes Insurance, a 'full stack' insurer licensed to underwrite risk by the French regulator ACPR. With a growing corporate client base (350+ and counting), our diverse team is headquartered in Paris and operates out of our 13 global offices in North America, Europe, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan. Descartes is trusted by a panel of A-rated (re)insurers to carry out its activities.




ABOUT YOUR ROLE

Due to rapid growth we are seeking to recruit a Data Scientist - Intern (end of study) to further expand our Data Science team, for a period of 6 months. At the core of our company’s strategy, your missions will focus on making direct contributions to the development of new climate models or forecasting tools.


Your responsibilities would include:

  • Improving or developing new models to improve our understanding of climate;
  • Participating in the development of Descartes’ technological platform;
  • Identifying, implementing and deploying new statistical and machine learning methods to differentiate Descartes from its competitors;
  • Collaborate with the business team to fully understand our B2B client needs and further strengthen our technical excellence;
  • Participate in our R&D sessions.




ABOUT YOU


EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

  • Final year Masters student in computer science, data science, applied mathematics, physics, statistics or meteorological studies;
  • Ideally a previous professional experience (internship and/or project) in Data Science.


SKILLS

  • Keen interest in climate related topics;
  • Highly skilled in statistics, applied mathematics and machine learning methods;
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal communication) required;
  • Proficient in Python.


MINDSET

  • Interested in weather and natural perils modelling (wildfires, hail, tsunamis, earthquakes etc);
  • Strong team spirit and ability to work under pressure;
  • Highly motivated, able to meet deadlines set;
  • Strong desire to learn and commitment to the organization’s mission;
  • Results oriented, high energy, with the ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment;
  • Motivated to help improving businesses’ and communities’ resilience to climate change;
  • Eagerness to work in an international environment.




WHY JOIN DESCARTES UNDERWRITING ?

  • Opportunity to work and learn with teams from the most prestigious schools and research labs in the world, allowing you to progress towards technical excellence;
  • Commitment from Descartes to its staff of continued learning and development (think annual seminars, training etc.);
  • Work in a collaborative & professional environment;
  • Be part of an international team, passionate about diversity;
  • Join a company with a true purpose – help us help our clients be more resilient towards climate risks;
  • A competitive salary, bonus and benefits;
  • You can benefit from a punctual home office days.


At Descartes Underwriting, we cherish value of diversity whatever it may be. We are committed to fighting against all forms of discrimination and for equal opportunities. We foster an inclusive work environment that respects all differences.

With equal skills, all our positions are open to people with disabilities.



RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • Step 1: HR Interview with our Talent Recruiter
  • Step 2: Technical online test
  • Step 3: Remote technical interview with a Data Scientist
  • Step 4: Team interview to meet your future team and discover our offices (held remotly if you are abroad)

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Data scientist

Als Data Scientist (speaking dutch fluently) bij Ordina Sopra steria werk je aan gave uitdagende projecten binnen Kunstmatige Intelligentie (AI) in een divers team van collega-data scientist. Jouw expertise en ambities vormen de basis voor onze High-Performance Teams (HPT's), waarin samenwerking en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan.




Werken als Data Scientist bij Ordina Sopra steria

Je wordt een onmisbare schakel in een team van professionals, waar iedereen bijdraagt vanuit zijn eigen expertise en technologie, en waar continue leren en samenwerken wordt gestimuleerd.
Je past je expertise toe in diverse domeinen, onderzoeken van betalingsstromen bij overheidsinstanties, het detecteren van fraude bij banken, het ontwikkelen van aanbevelingssystemen in de detailhandel, en het optimaliseren van supply chains.
Je ontwikkelt en implementeert oplossingen met Machine Learning en Deep Learning, en evalueert de prestaties van voorspellende modellen.




Waar jij komt te werken

In ons Data-domein creëren we duurzame waarde voor klanten door data en technologie te integreren in dagelijkse operaties en strategische besluitvorming. Ons doel is organisaties te helpen excelleren met data.




Het Data-domein omvat vijf praktijken: Data Governance, Data Management, Data Visualisatie, Data Science en AI, Data Engineering en Data Migraties, en Spatial Intelligence. Elke praktijk biedt gerichte oplossingen en wordt ondersteund door meer dan 170 professionals met diverse expertise. Wij geloven in de kracht van multidisciplinaire teams.




Dit ben jij

Jij bent een enthousiaste en ondernemende professional die initiatief neemt en graag bijdraagt aan een collegiale werkomgeving. Je waardeert kennisdeling en samenwerking, en bent in staat om jouw ideeën en inzichten te delen met collega's. Met een proactieve houding ben je gemotiveerd om samen met anderen innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen. In onze organisatie krijg je de ruimte om je ondernemerschap te tonen en bij te dragen aan een cultuur waarin teamwork en continue ontwikkeling centraal staan.




Verder neem je mee:

Bachelor en of masterdiploma of gelijkwaardige ervaring in Data Science, Machine Learning of Software Engineering.
Minimaal 2 jaar praktijkervaring met machine learning technieken en programmeertalen zoals Python of R.
Ervaring met implementatie van Data Science-oplossingen in productieomgevingen (bijv. Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, enz.).
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.




Waarom Ordina Sopra steria?

Naast uitdagende werkmogelijkheden, een open werkcultuur en leuke collega’s, bieden wij jou ook de vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je professionele doelen te behalen door een ruim aanbod aan trainingen aan te bieden. Daarnaast bieden wij ook de volgende andere punten:

Een vast contract
Basis salaris tussen de €4000 en €6500 o.b.v. 40 uur
Flexibele werkomgeving waar je zelfstandig tijd en plaats kunt bepalen
Mobiliteitsbudget met keuze voor een leaseauto of eigen vervoer
Flex benefit budget en collectieve regelingen
Keuze uit een MacBook Pro (inc Apple accessoires) of Windows laptop
Een betrokken community gericht op teambuilding, gaming en evenementen




Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren. Wij geloven namelijk in de kracht van diversiteit en waarderen inclusie. De beste ideeën en slimste oplossingen ontstaan immers in diverse teams. Daarom besteden we veel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high-performance teams. Zodat jij je thuis voelt en het beste uit jezelf kunt halen.




Ben je klaar om je carrière een boost te geven? Solliciteer dan direct voor de functie van Data Scientist bij Ordina sopra steria!

Show more

Ben je klaar om je carrière een boost te geven? Solliciteer dan direct voor de functie van Data Scientist bij Ordina sopra steria!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we:




Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.

Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:




We are looking for a Data Scientist to integrate one of our largest international partners in the telecommunications sector. It is one of the biggest references in the area, with a significant presence in more than 6 countries.




What you will do:




As a Data Scientist, you will collect, interpret, and publish data that will help to make business decisions in a specific time frame to determine how successful those decisions can be.




What you are like:




• Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science);

• 2+ years experience as a Data Scientist or in a role closely related to data (e.g. Analytics);

• 2+ years of scripting with one of these languages (PHP, R, PYTHON);

• Experience with packages such as NumPy, SciPy, pandas, scikit-learn, dplyr, ggplot2.







Why join us:




• Work on challenging projects for big clients

• Learn more about emerging technologies

• Possibility of working remotely

• Design your career plan

• Access to continuous training and certifications

• Evolve through our internal mobility program

• … and much more!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Breng de digitale wereld tot leven bij een wereldmerk. Jouw high-end rapporten bereiken honderden collega's en klanten binnen de Benelux. Dit vereist doorzettingsvermogen en de drive om te blijven groeien. Als Data Scientist is dit jouw rol bij DHL.







Dit ga je doen

Als Data Scientist speel je een cruciale rol in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van data gestuurde analyses. Deze analyses, gebaseerd op complexe datasets, bieden waardevolle inzichten voor DHL. Dit omvat het verwerken van grote hoeveelheden ongestructureerde data uit verschillende bronnen om DHL en haar klanten beter te dienen.

Je werkt met de nieuwste technologieën, zoals Azure Databricks, om de meest relevante waarden te presenteren aan afdelingen zoals Operations, Finance en Customer Service. Je werkt volgens de principes van Agile ontwikkeling aan uiteenlopende projecten binnen het gehele bedrijf. Jij bouwt het, jij runt het, jij bent verantwoordelijk! Je besteedt minimaal 32 uur per week aan:




Het analyseren van data, het identificeren van patronen en trends, en het presenteren van bevindingen aan belanghebbenden.
Samenwerken met teams binnen IT/Digital om de beste data gestuurde oplossingen voor te stellen.
Ondersteunen bij het beantwoorden van strategische en operationele vraagstukken door het ontwikkelen van datagestuurde analyses.




Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je werkt op het hoofdkantoor van DHL eCommerce in Utrecht. Als Data Scientist werk je samen met ingenieurs, producteigenaren en andere wetenschappers in een Scrum-team. Naast je directe collega's heb je ook contact met andere teams en afdelingen. De afdeling Digital en IT, waar je voor werkt, bestaat nu uit 250 collega's.




We luisteren altijd naar wat je te zeggen hebt. Hoe meer perspectieven en meningen we horen, hoe beter we allemaal worden. Dat is waarom onze organisatie het Great Place to Work-certificaat heeft ontvangen, gebaseerd op feedback van medewerkers.




Dit ben jij

Het bouwen aan de toekomst van levering geeft je energie. Elke keer als je een DHL-van voorbij ziet komen, voel je een gevoel van trots - en terecht, want jij draagt bij aan de ontwikkeling ervan. Je bent een vastberaden individu dat goed gedijt in een teamomgeving. Bij DHL werk je met de nieuwste technieken aan grote en schaalbare platformen - een omgeving die je als geen ander aanspreekt.




Verder heb je:

Minimaal een hbo- of universitair werk- en denkniveau.
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie.
Sterke programmeervaardigheden, bij voorkeur in Scala.
Ervaring met Spark, CI/CD, Terraform en Kafka.
De wil en nieuwsgierigheid om te werken met event-driven architecture.
Bekendheid met cloud-based oplossingen zoals Azure.




Dit krijg jij

Een baan om trots op te zijn! En niet zomaar een baan, wij gebruiken liever het woord carrière. Als Data Scientist wil jij je namelijk blijven ontwikkelen!




Voor de functie van Data Scientist kan jij rekenen op:

Een salaris tussen € 4.000,- en € 5.500,- bruto op basis van 40 uur, gebaseerd op je kennis en ervaring;
Een bonusregeling van 5%;
Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld;
Cao a la carte, een budget naar keuze voor extra salaris of vakantiedagen (4,5 dagen per jaar);
Reiskostenvergoeding tot 30 kilometer per enkele reis;
Pensioenregeling;
De mogelijkheid om hybride te werken;
Vanaf dag één uitgebreide opleidings- en trainingsmogelijkheden;
Kansen en mogelijkheden voor ontwikkeling en doorgroei, zowel nationaal- als internationaal!







De toekomst van bezorgen is geel-rood

DHL eCommerce is het meest toonaangevende logistiek bedrijf ter wereld. Dat klinkt misschien opschepperig, maar zo bedoelen we het niet: we zien het namelijk niet als een verdienste, maar als een verantwoordelijkheid. Dankzij onze positie kunnen we het verschil maken voor onze mensen, het milieu en de maatschappij. En dat blijkt: we zijn een Great Place to Work, hebben de groenste duurzaamheidsplannen in de logistiek en helpen via DHL Cares ontzettend veel mensen die dat hard kunnen gebruiken – daar zijn we trots op!







Solliciteren?

We ontvangen graag je cv en motivatiebrief. Heb je naar aanleiding van de vacature nog vragen? Neem contact op met Aard Knol, recruitment, via aard.knol@dhl.com of tel. 06-13448889.




VOG-screening en toetsing aan sanctielijsten en het interne en externe waarschuwingsregister (WLS) maken (mogelijk) deel uit van de sollicitatieprocedure.

Show more

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Non abbiamo bisogno solo di competenze, ma di voglia di trasformare ed avere un impatto sul futuro del nostro business. In OVS SpA la tecnologia è il fulcro delle nostre strategie di sviluppo, ma abbiamo bisogno di competenze nuove in grado di integrare sempre di più esperienza fisica e virtuale.

All'interno del team Digital Transformation & Information Technology, supporterai la definizione delle tecnologie per la gestione e l'elaborazione tempestiva dei dati raccolti sui vari touchpoint di interazione con i clienti, sia fisici che digitali. Con l'obiettivo di impostare i processi e definire nuove procedure, ti occuperai di:


Individuare soluzioni tecnologiche e definire best practice
Disegnare l'architettura di riferimento
Coordinare i team di sviluppo coinvolti
Recepire i requisiti business e declinarli ottimizzando performance e costi


Inviaci la tua candidatura soprattutto se hai:


Significativa conoscenza delle architetture software, con particolare riferimento alle architetture dati
Significativa esperienza nella conduzione di progetti software
Significativa esperienza in uno dei linguaggi R o Python
Conoscenza delle piattaforme big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks, ...)
Significativa conoscenza della basi dati relazionali e noSQL
Conoscenza di Microsoft Azure o di altro provider Cloud
Dimestichezza nell'applicazione del framework agile (es. Scrum) come anche nella conduzione di progetti con metodologia waterfall
Buona conoscenza dell'inglese


In OVS SpA troverai un'azienda strutturata, un ambiente dinamico e fortemente orientato al risultato. Stiamo innovando la tradizione, con un forte investimento sulle nuove tecnologie, per offrire a clienti e dipendenti un'esperienza sempre più completa e digitale, senza trascurare l'attenzione per l'ambiente, il futuro e la sostenibilità.

Ti garantiamo inoltre un percorso di selezione equo ed inclusivo, per offrire pari opportunità di accesso al lavoro.

WEAR YOUR CHANCE

We are your chance!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Any location within Spain

Hybrid/Remote way of working




Would you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project reinforcing the management and evolution of products/projects in the Sustainability and Financial Sectors? Do you enjoy working in Big Data and Advanced Analytics initiatives that solve real world problems? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!




In the CoE of Advanced Analytics in Fujitsu we are currently looking for a Data Scientist to continue the growth of our team, leverage our product portfolio, and develop new data driven solutions by innovation through investigation.




As our future Data Scientist:




You will be focused on explainability, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to innovate and contribute to research in the field of Data Science by:




Assessing the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Developing processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
Identifying patterns, trends, and significant relationships within data.
Building custom data models and algorithms to support the business.
Using predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, and other business outcomes.
Using advanced NLP techniques to extract relevant information from unstructured text.
Researching and developing methods to strengthen the current models.
Sharing investigation findings clearly and understandably with non-technical stakeholders.
Coordinating with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Keeping up to date with the latest trends in Data Science and emerging technologies to propose creative and efficient solutions for specific challenges.




Your profile




You have a Degree, Master’s and/or a PhD preferably in Computer Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or another quantitative field, and a minimum of 3 years of experience working preferably within the IT Consultancy industry.




Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development and innovation.
Solid experience in NLP, explainable AI, and predictive modeling.
Experience using statistical computer languages (Python, R, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Capability to produce optimized and efficient production code.
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure and/or AWS is a plus
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.




You are curious by nature and were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results and find creative solutions. Besides having excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams, you are also fluent both in Spanish and English.




Shape your world and achieve together




We want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.




What is in it for you?




When you join our team, we offer you an attractive salary and secondary benefits, including a variable bonus scheme. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with flexible working times, great social benefits, lots of room for personal growth, additional training possibilities, and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work Certification.




About Fujitsu




Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.




More information: www.fujitsu.com

Title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Position: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Cologne (2 days remote per week)

Salary: €55,000 - €60,000




Join a leading German comparison company as the first ML hire in Cologne, supported by a 10-member team in Munich.




Responsibilities:

Lead Data Science Initiatives: Develop the data science department, automate business processes, and deliver customized customer solutions.
Implement Solutions: Create ML services focused on recommendation systems, ranking, information extraction, and predictions. Handle conceptual design, data preparation, model training, evaluation, and deployment.
MLOps Management: Use frameworks like MLFlow for experiment management, enhancing our product with cloud technologies (AWS).
Innovate with AI: Stay current with ML advancements, exploring generative AI models like Transformers and ChatGPT.
Collaborate: Work closely with product managers, developers, and BI managers in a cross-disciplinary team.




Requirements:

Education: Excellent degree in data science, (business) informatics, mathematics, physics, or statistics.
Skills: Proficiency in AI/ML stacks (NLP, LLMs, computer vision), basic server and API architecture knowledge.
Languages: Strong German and English communication skills.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Senior MLOps Engineer / Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Hybrid (office in Utrecht, Netherlands, 2-3 days a week)

Sponsorship: Not possible

Salary range: 60k to 75k EUR/yearly and employee stock options

Required years of experience: +5 years




About Spatialise:

Spatialise is a dynamic Dutch startup founded in 2021, which is leading the way in digital soil health monitoring. As a pioneering start-up, we focus on harnessing remote sensing to empower farmers worldwide, helping them adapt to increasing pressures from global population growth and evolving legislation. Our mission extends beyond commercial success—we are committed to promoting sustainable, regenerative agricultural practices that enhance soil health and reduce pressure on our precious soils. Our product enables project developers, large corporations and NGOs with a scalable solution to measure and quantify the impact of their regenerative agricultural practices on soil nutrient levels.




About the Role:

The MLOps/ML Engineer role is pivotal in ensuring the seamless integration and operational efficiency of machine learning models within our organization. This position demands a blend of skills in environment management, data handling, code integration, and model management. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience deploying and managing environments using Docker and Kubernetes, as well as overseeing compute resources to optimize deployment costs. A critical part of this role involves implementing and maintaining deployments on cloud platforms such as Databricks, ensuring our ML models are scalable, reliable, and effectively integrated into our workflows.

In addition to environment management, the MLOps/ML Engineer will oversee data ingestion from various databases, implementing robust data lineage and feature engineering practices to maintain data integrity and traceability. The candidate will be responsible for developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, enforcing version control, and conducting thorough code reviews to ensure high-quality, reproducible code. Furthermore, the role involves the deployment, monitoring, and retraining of machine learning models, managing ML model endpoints, and creating internal dashboards to monitor performance. Collaboration is key, as the engineer will work closely with full-stack developers and AI scientists to integrate and optimize ML solutions, contributing to the continuous improvement of our machine learning operations.




Key Responsibilities:

Environment Management:
Deploy and manage environments using Docker and Kubernetes.
Manage compute resources and control deployment costs.
Implement and maintain deployments to cloud platforms like Databricks.
Data Handling:
Oversee data ingestion from various databases.
Implement data lineage and feature engineering practices.
Ensure data cleanliness and consider the integration of data streaming processes.

2. Code Integration and Management:

Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines across development, testing, and production environments.
Enforce version control and conduct code reviews to ensure reproducibility and quality.

3. Model Management:

Handle the deployment, monitoring, and retraining of machine learning models.
Manage ML model endpoints and internal dashboard creation.

4. Inference and Optimization:

Develop APIs for model inference and optimize machine learning services for performance and scalability.

5. General Operations:

Construct and maintain efficient pipelines and automate permission management.

6. Collaboration:

Work closely with our full-stack developers and AI scientists to integrate and optimize ML solutions.




Ideal Candidate:

Technical Expertise:
Proficient in Kubernetes (K8S) and familiar with Python, PyTorch, and MLFlow.
Strong experience in cloud platforms, particularly Azure and Databricks.
Solid understanding of MLOps or DevOps principles with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience.
Proven ability to establish and maintain MLOps pipelines.
Experienced in managing multiple environments.

2. Personal Qualities:

Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Detail-oriented with a passion for technology and continuous learning.
Intra- and entrepreneurial skills. Ability to challenge yourself to the next level.
Unique opportunity to join the team that encourages people to implement their skills, passions and abilities to the fullest.




Our offer:

A short recruitment process: offer in two meetings!
60k to 75k EUR/yearly.
28 days of paid vacation.
0.8 FTE - 1.0 FTE, unlimited contract.
Employee stock options: take part in our success.
Accommodating employment conditions.




Preferred starting date: August/September 2024

How to Apply: Please submit your resume along with a short cover letter and any relevant project samples or publications to info@spatiali.se. We are excited to hear how your background, skills, and passions align with our mission to enhance agricultural practices through advanced remote sensing.

We look forward to your application and potentially welcoming you to our team to drive innovation in agricultural technology!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist

Location: Lisbon - Hybrid

Salary: €60,000 - €65,000




We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python, data types, and basic algorithms, with expertise in memory management, data manipulation using Pandas and Numpy, and scientific computing with Scipy. Additionally, a solid understanding of probability theory, time series analysis, classical machine learning algorithms, and deep learning is essential.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Manipulation and Analysis:

Utilize Pandas, Numpy, and Scipy for efficient data manipulation and analysis.
Implement and optimize basic algorithms with a focus on memory management.




Probability and Statistics:

Apply probability theory concepts including probability density, cumulative distribution function, normal distribution, and quantiles.
Conduct time series analysis, focusing on autocorrelations, stationarity, and statistical criteria for time series.




Machine Learning:

Develop and implement forecasting algorithms and evaluate their performance using relevant metrics.
Apply classical machine learning algorithms including decision trees, gradient boosting, and xgboost.
Design, train, evaluate, and deploy deep learning models using Pytorch.




System Design and Deployment:

Ensure effective model monitoring and horizontal scaling.
Address system design topics to optimize model deployment and performance.




Requirements:




Technical Skills:

Proficient in Python, with a deep understanding of data types, basic algorithms, and memory management.
Experience with data manipulation and analysis using Pandas, Numpy, and Scipy.
Strong knowledge of probability theory and its applications in data science.
Expertise in time series analysis and forecasting.
Proficient in classical machine learning algorithms and boosting techniques.
Experienced in deep learning with a focus on neural networks and Pytorch.




Additional Skills:

Ability to train, evaluate, and deploy machine learning models.
Strong understanding of model monitoring and horizontal scaling.
Familiarity with system design concepts related to data science and machine learning.




If you are interested in finding out more, please APPLY & get in touch with Libby Dewar @ Allegiance Technology

Title: Data Scientist, Renewable Energy Forecasting
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Data Scientist? Do you want to develop algorithms for forecasting and trading renewable electricity? And are you interested in working at a Scale-Up that contributes intelligent solutions to the energy infrastructure of the future? Then green.ai might have the job for you.




We are looking for a Data Scientist for our Asset team to develop fully automated algorithms to help wind turbines, solar panels and other electricity producers to get the most out of their assets. 




Responsibilities:




Develop and deploy different ml algorithms, enhancing our capabilities to forecast and trade
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate algorithms into our platform




Qualifications - we imagine that you:




Have a strong theoretical background and understanding of statistics/probability theory/optimization 
Are knowledgeable about implementing machine learning algorithms (e.g. time-series models In python)
Are comfortable integrating models into a cloud-based infrastructure in collaboration with the team
Thrive in an environment that provides autonomy - with possibility of working either from your home office or from our office in the heart of Copenhagen
Have great communication skills - both with business stakeholders and with technical colleagues 




About us:




green.ai is an AI and technology company that develops algorithms for the global power system. This includes both distribution of power as well as trading. We are a scale-up with the heart of a start-up, creating time, space, and opportunities for employees to think innovatively and to test new algorithms. The team currently consists of 8 employees (and growing!), all energy data experts working to create the best solutions for the green power system of tomorrow.




We offer:




Work on some very cool algorithms that truly help our partners
Nice office close to the Metro (Gammel Strand) located in the Copenhagen center
Full-time position and salary according to qualifications along with pension
A flexible work schedule with opportunities to work remote when needed
An informal workplace where we care about each other
Annual company events and lots of social events
Lunch, coffee and snacks




Contact information:




If you are interested in the position or would like to learn more, please send your CV with contact information to: contact@green.ai or reach out to:

Peter Alexander Stentoft at mobile +45 5074 9651 or Kasper Hakon Sørensen at mobile +45 3016 0690

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
NUEVA OPORTUNIDAD DATA SCIENTIST! BUSCAS UN CAMBIO? TIENES EXPERIENCIA EN PRICING? ESTA OPORTUNIDAD ES PARA TI




📍Ubicación: HIBRIDO EN BARCELONA

⌚Empezar: ASAP

📜Tipo de contrato: freelance

🗣️Idioma: Español

✅Experiencia: PRICING




Acerca de la empresa:




Es un líder mundial en la industria minorista internacional. Empresa de diseño y fabricación de ropa, diseña, fabrica y comercializa ropa y accesorios para mujer y hombre.




¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos de data science con enfoque en pricing de promociones.
Capacidad para prototipar soluciones basadas en Machine Learning y liderar proyectos desde la fase de prototipo hasta la producción y mantenimiento.
Al menos 4 años de experiencia en desarrollo en Python u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.
Experiencia en el uso de librerías de previsión de demanda y modelización de elasticidad.
Conocimiento de algoritmos de optimización y librerías Python asociadas.
Interés en buenas prácticas de programación y desarrollo de software.
Experiencia con servicios cloud (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) es valorada positivamente.
Personalidad comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar y mentalidad hands-on.




¡Tu recomendación también cuenta en nuestro programa 'SHARE & EARN’, donde podrás ganar 500EUR si seleccionan al candidato que has recomendado. Envíame un correo a ibermudez@k2partnering.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (LLMs)
Description:
At Sinch, we pioneer the way the world communicates. Our customer communications cloud empowers businesses to reach everyone in world, in seconds or less, through mobile messaging, email, voice and video. We reach every phone on the planet 7 times a year and 8 out of 10 largest US tech companies are our customers. Sinch AI adds a layer of intentional intelligence on top of that, to build smarter, safer conversational experiences, faster.

As a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer, you will play a vital role in building and expanding the core machine learning capabilities of Conversational AI at Sinch. Working as part of a dynamic and cross-functional team, you will have the autonomy to define objectives and goals, taking ownership of the entire product development life cycle - from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance.

You will work on the intersection of the Generative AI team and the Conversational AI team of Sinch. The Conversational AI team is responsible for all conversational experiences in Sinch Chatlayer, Sinch Engage, and Sinch MessageMedia. Here, your focus will be on leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and generative AI to both make bot building much easier and bots themselves much more effective, natural and enjoyable. You will evaluate, test, customize, deploy, and integrate the latest LLMs into the platform to create more advanced and intuitive conversational experiences.

Our tech stack: Python, Kubernetes, GCP, AWS, PyTorch, MLFlow, OpenSearch, LangChain, OpenAI LLMs, Gemini LLMs, Open-Source LLMs like LLama

As a Machine Learning Engineer, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Experimenting with, applying, and benchmarking new algorithms, with a strong emphasis on LLMs and generative AI
Deploying machine learning code in the cloud
Proactively exploring new and emerging (generative) AI solutions that can enhance the value delivered to our product and customers
Contributing your innovative ideas to enable the development of human-like chat and voice bots using the latest advancements in generative AI
Setting up proof-of-concepts and transforming them into production-ready features


Requirements


You are an AI enthusiast who keeps up with the latest trends in AI and ML, and loves to use these new technologies to solve real-world problems
You have worked with machine learning for at least three years and are familiar with common natural language processing and machine learning concepts such as clustering, embeddings, neural networks,...
You have put machine learning applications in production before and are familiar with concepts such as unit testing, CI/CD pipelines and monitoring, but also on how you measure the quality of the machine learning solution
You have built an LLM-based application and are keen to build many more!
You are proficient in Python
You are fluent in English


Benefits

Sinch is a global company composed of people from different countries and cultures. Our benefits adjust regionally to support employees and help them to thrive in every stage of life. We offer valuable benefits and resources, including health and life insurance, a flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.

Our Hiring Process

In Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and equal opportunity. Our Talent Acquisition team, together with hiring managers and the rest of the interviewing team, persistently works towards identifying the people that best fit each open job, based on Sinch' s hiring needs and candidates' career expectations.

We encourage applications from strong candidates with relevant professional backgrounds for this role. Not all applicants will meet all job requirements exactly! Don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always open to candidates that could bring new insights and perspectives to Sinch!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Sanctions Screening
Description:
Company Description

Wise is a global technology company, building the best way to move and manage the world’s money. Min fees. Max ease. Full speed.

Whether people and businesses are sending money to another country, spending abroad, or making and receiving international payments, Wise is on a mission to make their life easier and save them money.

As part of our team, you will be helping us create an entirely new network for the world's money. For everyone, everywhere.

More about our mission.

Job Description

We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our growing Sanctions Screening Team in Tallinn.

This role is a unique opportunity to work behind the scenes of company transactions, understand how we mitigate risk and at the same time provide our customers with the seamless service they deserve. What you build will have a direct impact on Wise’s mission and millions of our customers.

About The Role

Our screening team is responsible for sanctions, PEPs (Politically Exposed Persons) and Adverse Media screening.

The screening team has a name matching service that is routinely tested against an internal benchmarking suite, and annually against external benchmarking suites.

We are looking for someone to own the testing, tuning and optimisation of these matching algorithms. The candidate will own this function - be responsible for the overall testing and tuning strategy, deep dive testing results, understanding how to optimise rules for efficiency and effectiveness and create rules for complex controls.

Here’s How You’ll Be Contributing


Automatising algorithm testing on real customer data as well as synthetic data. Packaging the service into a library or deploying it to staging or production environments
Benchmark testing
Analyse results from exact name matching and fuzzy name matching against internal and external benchmarks
Identify and categorise types of missed cases and map those to known or new issues
Propose technical solutions to reduce the number of missed cases identified
Benchmark creation
Design an internal test set to evaluate both the precision and recall of the screening engine
Align performance on the test set with real-life production performance
Extend internal benchmarking to new scenarios for better coverage of screening algorithms
Define an overall strategy for testing and tuning
Evaluate the use of an internal benchmarking tool
Evaluate testing capabilities of external vendors in the market to define the most effective method of continuous external benchmarking, processes of governance
Tailor business rules to reduce hit rate, prepare tuning data, reviewing hit reduction strategies and work with product managers, compliance and engineers to ensure roadmap alignment
Rule optimisation
Tweaking engine configuration to find the sweet spot for precision and recall.
Provide answers on how many historical true positives we would miss based on different optimisations
Work on advanced rules for complicated controls, such as vessel screening
Uncover and action on opportunities to help the Screening operational team scale
Automatising or creating solutions to assist operations in their work
Modify existing tooling introducing LLM assistants to improve the efficiency of agents and speed of case resolution

A Bit About You


Experience implementing, testing and evaluating performance of multiple rules across systems;
Strong Python knowledge. Ability to read through code, especially Java. Demonstrable experience collaborating with engineering on services;
Strong algorithmic design and testing skills. A big plus for proven experience with name matching algorithms;
Experience with statistical analysis and good presentation skills to drive insight into action;
A strong product mindset with the ability to work independently in a cross-functional and cross-team environment;
Good communication skills and ability to get the point across to non-technical individuals;
Strong problem solving skills with the ability to help refine problem statements and figure out how to solve them.


Some Extra Skills That Are Great (but Not Essential)


Familiarity with automating operational processes through technical solution, for example Large Language Models;
Knowledge of Sanctions and Name Screening Optimisation and Tuning
Experience working in a heavily regulated business domain.


Additional Information

For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.

We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.

Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.

If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.

Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Breng de digitale wereld tot leven bij een wereldmerk. Jouw high-end rapporten bereiken honderden collega's en klanten binnen de Benelux. Dit vereist doorzettingsvermogen en de drive om te blijven groeien. Als Data Scientist is dit jouw rol bij DHL.







Dit ga je doen

Als Data Scientist speel je een cruciale rol in het ontwikkelen en implementeren van data gestuurde analyses. Deze analyses, gebaseerd op complexe datasets, bieden waardevolle inzichten voor DHL. Dit omvat het verwerken van grote hoeveelheden ongestructureerde data uit verschillende bronnen om DHL en haar klanten beter te dienen.

Je werkt met de nieuwste technologieën, zoals Azure Databricks, om de meest relevante waarden te presenteren aan afdelingen zoals Operations, Finance en Customer Service. Je werkt volgens de principes van Agile ontwikkeling aan uiteenlopende projecten binnen het gehele bedrijf. Jij bouwt het, jij runt het, jij bent verantwoordelijk! Je besteedt minimaal 32 uur per week aan:




Het analyseren van data, het identificeren van patronen en trends, en het presenteren van bevindingen aan belanghebbenden.
Samenwerken met teams binnen IT/Digital om de beste data gestuurde oplossingen voor te stellen.
Ondersteunen bij het beantwoorden van strategische en operationele vraagstukken door het ontwikkelen van datagestuurde analyses.




Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je werkt op het hoofdkantoor van DHL eCommerce in Utrecht. Als Data Scientist werk je samen met ingenieurs, producteigenaren en andere wetenschappers in een Scrum-team. Naast je directe collega's heb je ook contact met andere teams en afdelingen. De afdeling Digital en IT, waar je voor werkt, bestaat nu uit 250 collega's.




We luisteren altijd naar wat je te zeggen hebt. Hoe meer perspectieven en meningen we horen, hoe beter we allemaal worden. Dat is waarom onze organisatie het Great Place to Work-certificaat heeft ontvangen, gebaseerd op feedback van medewerkers.




Dit ben jij

Het bouwen aan de toekomst van levering geeft je energie. Elke keer als je een DHL-van voorbij ziet komen, voel je een gevoel van trots - en terecht, want jij draagt bij aan de ontwikkeling ervan. Je bent een vastberaden individu dat goed gedijt in een teamomgeving. Bij DHL werk je met de nieuwste technieken aan grote en schaalbare platformen - een omgeving die je als geen ander aanspreekt.




Verder heb je:

Minimaal een hbo- of universitair werk- en denkniveau.
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie.
Sterke programmeervaardigheden, bij voorkeur in Scala.
Ervaring met Spark, CI/CD, Terraform en Kafka.
De wil en nieuwsgierigheid om te werken met event-driven architecture.
Bekendheid met cloud-based oplossingen zoals Azure.




Dit krijg jij

Een baan om trots op te zijn! En niet zomaar een baan, wij gebruiken liever het woord carrière. Als Data Scientist wil jij je namelijk blijven ontwikkelen!




Voor de functie van Data Scientist kan jij rekenen op:

Een salaris tussen € 4.000,- en € 5.500,- bruto op basis van 40 uur, gebaseerd op je kennis en ervaring;
Een bonusregeling van 5%;
Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld;
Cao a la carte, een budget naar keuze voor extra salaris of vakantiedagen (4,5 dagen per jaar);
Reiskostenvergoeding tot 30 kilometer per enkele reis;
Pensioenregeling;
De mogelijkheid om hybride te werken;
Vanaf dag één uitgebreide opleidings- en trainingsmogelijkheden;
Kansen en mogelijkheden voor ontwikkeling en doorgroei, zowel nationaal- als internationaal!







De toekomst van bezorgen is geel-rood

DHL eCommerce is het meest toonaangevende logistiek bedrijf ter wereld. Dat klinkt misschien opschepperig, maar zo bedoelen we het niet: we zien het namelijk niet als een verdienste, maar als een verantwoordelijkheid. Dankzij onze positie kunnen we het verschil maken voor onze mensen, het milieu en de maatschappij. En dat blijkt: we zijn een Great Place to Work, hebben de groenste duurzaamheidsplannen in de logistiek en helpen via DHL Cares ontzettend veel mensen die dat hard kunnen gebruiken – daar zijn we trots op!







Solliciteren?

We ontvangen graag je cv en motivatiebrief. Heb je naar aanleiding van de vacature nog vragen? Neem contact op met Aard Knol, recruitment, via aard.knol@dhl.com of tel. 06-13448889.




VOG-screening en toetsing aan sanctielijsten en het interne en externe waarschuwingsregister (WLS) maken (mogelijk) deel uit van de sollicitatieprocedure.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
**The client can also offer sponsorship and relocation packages!




***Please note this role is based in Munich with 2 days in the office!




Few&Far are partnered with one of the fastest-growing travel tech companies in Europe. They recently secured €100 million funding round allowing them to improve all of their services and achieve their next milestones.

Responsibilities




Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

  • Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
  • Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
  • Generate actionable insights for business improvements


Qualifications


  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
  • Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
  • Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
  • Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau)

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Non abbiamo bisogno solo di competenze, ma di voglia di trasformare ed avere un impatto sul futuro del nostro business. In OVS SpA la tecnologia è il fulcro delle nostre strategie di sviluppo, ma abbiamo bisogno di competenze nuove in grado di integrare sempre di più esperienza fisica e virtuale.

All'interno del team Digital Transformation & Information Technology, supporterai la definizione delle tecnologie per la gestione e l'elaborazione tempestiva dei dati raccolti sui vari touchpoint di interazione con i clienti, sia fisici che digitali. Con l'obiettivo di impostare i processi e definire nuove procedure, ti occuperai di:


Individuare soluzioni tecnologiche e definire best practice
Disegnare l'architettura di riferimento
Coordinare i team di sviluppo coinvolti
Recepire i requisiti business e declinarli ottimizzando performance e costi


Inviaci la tua candidatura soprattutto se hai:


Significativa conoscenza delle architetture software, con particolare riferimento alle architetture dati
Significativa esperienza nella conduzione di progetti software
Significativa esperienza in uno dei linguaggi R o Python
Conoscenza delle piattaforme big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks, ...)
Significativa conoscenza della basi dati relazionali e noSQL
Conoscenza di Microsoft Azure o di altro provider Cloud
Dimestichezza nell'applicazione del framework agile (es. Scrum) come anche nella conduzione di progetti con metodologia waterfall
Buona conoscenza dell'inglese


In OVS SpA troverai un'azienda strutturata, un ambiente dinamico e fortemente orientato al risultato. Stiamo innovando la tradizione, con un forte investimento sulle nuove tecnologie, per offrire a clienti e dipendenti un'esperienza sempre più completa e digitale, senza trascurare l'attenzione per l'ambiente, il futuro e la sostenibilità.

Ti garantiamo inoltre un percorso di selezione equo ed inclusivo, per offrire pari opportunità di accesso al lavoro.

WEAR YOUR CHANCE

We are your chance!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Any location within Spain

Hybrid/Remote way of working




Would you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project reinforcing the management and evolution of products/projects in the Sustainability and Financial Sectors? Do you enjoy working in Big Data and Advanced Analytics initiatives that solve real world problems? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!




In the CoE of Advanced Analytics in Fujitsu we are currently looking for a Data Scientist to continue the growth of our team, leverage our product portfolio, and develop new data driven solutions by innovation through investigation.




As our future Data Scientist:




You will be focused on explainability, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Machine Learning. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to innovate and contribute to research in the field of Data Science by:




Assessing the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Developing processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
Identifying patterns, trends, and significant relationships within data.
Building custom data models and algorithms to support the business.
Using predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, and other business outcomes.
Using advanced NLP techniques to extract relevant information from unstructured text.
Researching and developing methods to strengthen the current models.
Sharing investigation findings clearly and understandably with non-technical stakeholders.
Coordinating with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Keeping up to date with the latest trends in Data Science and emerging technologies to propose creative and efficient solutions for specific challenges.




Your profile




You have a Degree, Master’s and/or a PhD preferably in Computer Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or another quantitative field, and a minimum of 3 years of experience working preferably within the IT Consultancy industry.




Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development and innovation.
Solid experience in NLP, explainable AI, and predictive modeling.
Experience using statistical computer languages (Python, R, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Capability to produce optimized and efficient production code.
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure and/or AWS is a plus
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.




You are curious by nature and were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results and find creative solutions. Besides having excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams, you are also fluent both in Spanish and English.




Shape your world and achieve together




We want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.




What is in it for you?




When you join our team, we offer you an attractive salary and secondary benefits, including a variable bonus scheme. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with flexible working times, great social benefits, lots of room for personal growth, additional training possibilities, and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work Certification.




About Fujitsu




Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.




More information: www.fujitsu.com

Title: ML Engineer, Entry (12 months contract)
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
The Company

HP is a Fortune 100 technology company with $58+ Billion in revenue, with over 50,000 employees operating in more than 170 countries around the world. We provide technology and services that help people and companies address their problems and challenges, and realize their possibilities, aspirations and dreams. We apply new thinking and ideas to create simpler, more valuable and trusted experiences with technology, continuously improving the way our customers live and work.

Position Background

In the GMT Advanced Analytics organization our mission is to deliver impact by building machine learning products to optimize pricing and marketing investments and provide guidance to HP's commercial sales organizations.

Our team consists of a diverse global team of economists, statisticians, data scientists, data engineers, software engineers, DevOps, and MLOps engineers, who are pushing the innovation frontier to bring new insights to our business.

Working with us you will use your Software Development best practices to deliver ML models to a production environment at scale.

Please note that it's a fixed-term role with a 12 month contract. Extension to permanent position is possible but not guarantee.

Responsibilities


Work with software engineers to understand systems and craft interfaces to models for deployment
Validate and optimize machine learning models, possibly utilizing new model architectures, optimization techniques or objective functions
Document & help other teams apply best practices


Job Requirements


Fluent in the Python language
Knowledge of Computer Science and Engineering Principles including algorithms, data structures, software architecture and design
Knowledge in CI/CD pipelines, i.e., GitHub actions, and GitHub workflows
Ability to work independently under a fast-paced environment and deliver results under pressure
Advanced verbal and written communication skills
Bachelor or Master's degree in Computer Science
Curiosity, a methodical approach and the ability to be a self-starter


Who We Are

At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. We use ideas to put technology to work for everyone. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. That is why everyone – at every level in every function, is encouraged to think big, have original ideas and express and share them. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we will invest in your ideas to change lives and the way people work. This vision is what sets us apart as a company. At HP, we work across borders and without limits. Global virtual teams share resources, pool their big ideas to solve our biggest business opportunities. Everyone is valued for the unique skills, experiences, and perspective they bring. That is how we work at HP. And this is how ideas and people grow.

Entity Sales Standard and Services
